page.title: 09GLYNWED-IRONBRIDGE
page.content: The{Coalbrookdale Company}was started by the{Quaker Ironmaster Abraham Darby {I.}In 1929 Allied Ironfounders took it over and in 1969 the works was taken over by Glynwed Foundries Ltd. Glynwed make parts of Aga cookers and Rayburn heaters and engineering parts. Now the iron works employ 216 people and they use 150-180 tons of iron a week. In the early 1800's 5000 people worked at the Coalbrookdale Works. They use coke from Bedwas, limestone from local areas, fine red sand from Bromsgrove, pig iron from British Steel and oxygen from British Oxygen. They spend 180 pounds on raw materials to make a ton of iron. They melt 150-180 tons of iron each week. They export the things they make to France, Belgium, Holland, South Africa, Japan and Ireland.
